result.execSummary:
The defendant Tremayne D Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Convert to a civil judgment. $200 DNA surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tremayne D Martin

10:22 AM Defendant Tremayne D Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Tremayne D Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Plea - w/o the repeater enhancer - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.  Repeater enhancer removed.

Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$150+cc+DNA, Reduce to a civil judgment.

8:46 AM Defendant Tremayne D Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Tremayne D Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Date set, matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's statements
State's Notice of Intent to introduce expert testimony
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with any individual possessing a weapon.

2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tremayne D Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Tremayne D Martin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
